turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Now, I'm getting interested.  I want to know more ---

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: We've got some things to discuss.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Did you know twenty-six members of your rifle company are coming?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: From the Korean War.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Conflict, honey.  Korean Conflict.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Whatever it was, they'll be here. We sent out invitations to everyone, plane tickets included -- the RSVP's are amazing.  A few of them we didn't hear from, and some of them are dead, of course --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: You know, we're going to give this party for you whether you like it or not.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I like it.  I like it.  I'm sorry I don't seem more appreciative.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: That's okay, Daddy.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Annie made them.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Who's Annie?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: From La Rosette, only the greatest pastry chef in America.  This is orange, from real Seville oranges.  Lemon, on a mille-feuille crust, a little on the fanciful. And a while, nothing like a good old white cake, vanilla, with Angel food but some maroons shavings thrown in.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't like cake.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: It's for the party, Dad --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Oh, the goddam party --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: 'Goddam party'!

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Hi, Daddy, what do you think?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: It's starting to grow on me.  But what do the 'B' and 'P' mean?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: The fountain is the Caspian Sea and the Sea is serving up caviar.  The 'B's for Beluga, the 'P' for Petrossian.  Of course, they also stand for 'Bill' and for 'Parrish'.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Do they, m'dear?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: -- Plus we've got a baritone with a balalaika coming from The Russian Tea Room.  I've dressed him in a Cossack shirt and he'll sing Nelson Eddy songs.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: I do it because I love you.  Because everybody I loved you.  Mommy -- wher- ever she is -- Susan, Quince, the people who work for you, everybody who's ever known you.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yeah?  And what about my enemies?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: They respect you.  Isn't that a kind of love?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I haven't been the father to you that --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: That you've been to Susan?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I wasn't going to say --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: But that's what you were thinking. And that's okay.  Because I know you love me.  Not like it is with Susan, the way your eyes light up when she comes in the room and the way she always gets a laugh out of you, as opposed to me when I walk in a room and that look comes over your face, "What does she want now?"

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You know, darling, this is going to be a wonderful party.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Honey, please.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Okay.  All aboard - New York, New York!

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Remember everybody, tonight, dinner in the city at Daddy's.  You too, Drew.  We've still got some loose ends --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: What about the Mayor?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: He said he would be there with bells on.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Please don't be negative, Drew, we have an acceptance list that would do The White House proud -- The Secretary-General of the UN, the Chairman of the FCC, nine Senators, I don't know how many Congressmen, and at least twelve of the Fortune '500'.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: No jocks?  A twenty-game winner or a Masters champion?  Someone I could talk to.  Or would talk to me.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Paillarde of veal.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Yeah, they hit the calf over the head with a mallet and then Luisa hits it again in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Honey --!

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: You know what I'm saying, Joe?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yeah, but --

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: What will I tell Annie?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: ...This shit's not bad.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: -- The late harvest Riesling, Mr. Quince, a possibility for dessert.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: And that?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Pinot Grigio.  We're considering it for the appetizer.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: What do you do that for?

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Well sir, it's 9:30 in the morning.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: 9:30's almost 10:30.  Where I come from, the sun's over the yardarm, m'boy, and the cocktail lamp is lit.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: I'm afraid this is a wine bar, Mr. Quince.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Okay, give me a bottle of wine.

turns.speaker: AMBROSE
turns.text: Red or white?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: BONTECOU
turns.text: Bill, thanks for coming over...  And how're you doing today, Drew?  You've got a firecracker here, the kid's really set the table.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Good, good.  Glad to hear it.

turns.speaker: BONTECOU
turns.text: We've met before, y'know, that White House function, the President had you on his right and you know where I was?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't recall --

turns.speaker: BONTECOU
turns.text: Left field somewhere.  Well, Bill, I want to come in from the outfield, bat cleanup like you have, learn the plush ropes --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I thought you were buying my company.

turns.speaker: BONTECOU
turns.text: Oh, Mr. Parrish, I could never buy Parrish Communications.  I could pay for it, of course, but it would always have your imprint.

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: Yes, sir?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hello.  I'm Joe Black.  Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: Yes sir, Mr. Black, a pleasure.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What are you eating.

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: You mean this, sir?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: 'Laura Scudder's Peanut Butter'.  You like it?

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: I would say, sir, it is right up there with Jif and Skippy.  But miles ahead of Peter Pan.  Like a taste?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I would prefer some peanut butter.

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: How would you like that, sir?  On some kind of toast?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Toast?  No...just the butter.

turns.speaker: COYLE
turns.text: Right away.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Hello, Beautiful.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: -- Did I hear 'business'?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What 'business'?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: ...See you tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Include me out.  I've had enough of the conversations.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You don't mean that.  You wouldn't disappoint Daddy --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Daddy'll do fine.  Besides, he's got Joe.  And so do you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Drew, you're out of line.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: That may be.  But I don't like the fucker.  I don't like the way he looks at you and talks to you.  And vice versa.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Sorry, but I like the way he looks and talks to me.  And vice versa. Okay?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: No, not okay.  I thought we had a good thing going here.  It shows you never know.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Well... goodnight.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Oh, you're the great Joe's attorney now?  Are we going to go to court? Or are we going to go to bed?  And I don't mean you and me.  I mean you and him.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: That's it.  It's over.  Get out.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: So I guess a blowjob's out of the question?

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: And what would that be?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Bill's birthday is the day after tomorrow.  There is a provisory by- law in our charter.  Per the discre- tion of the Board, Corporate off- icers can be retired at age sixty- five.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: You're taking this too far, Drew.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Am I not obligated to?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Thank you for coming.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: Hello, Quince.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: We're not getting anywhere here. Why don't we take some of the best out of this thing, let's consider it coolly, let's take a week --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Bontecou wants a speedier response than that.

turns.speaker: SLOANE
turns.text: He'll wait --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We have an arrangement now.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: What side of the industry did you say you were on?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I didn't say.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Joe sounds like a ringer, Bill.  I have the feeling you guys got the broad strokes already.  Need any help with the details?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Incidentally, Joe, where're you staying?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Here...

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'Here'?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Nice to see you.  I didn't expect you, but certainly you can't get enough of a good thing.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: The Board of Parrish Communications - is hereby called to order.  Our sole order of business is an acceptance of John Bontecou's generous offer and --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Do you have any more of these deli- cious cookies?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Anything else, Mr. Black?  How about some water?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Why yes, thank you.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Hot or cold.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Cold.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: And a glass.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: "Death and Taxes"?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What an odd pairing.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: It's just a saying, Mr. Black,

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Of whom?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: It doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Then why did you bring it up?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: May I interrupting?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Well, I'm going to tell you anyway. I did cheat on that exam at Groton. But so did twenty-six other guys, and nobody ever mentioned it until today.  And I'm expecting you won't mention it again.  I don't know who you are and where you're getting your information, but I'm willing to pretend I did not hear it, and let bygones be bygones.  But can I tell you something else, it'd be nice to see the big guy without you next to him.  What are you, his shadow?  Do you hold his dick for him when he goes to take a leak?  You know some- times somebody would like a few min- utes alone with W.P.  That means without you.  Okay, pal?  Let's eat.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Who are we talking about?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But I know she's grateful for the care you're giving her.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Is this a state secret or are we being excluded just for the fun of it?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Susan's patient is whom we are talking about.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Perhaps you could remind me.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'll make a note of it.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, I don't --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Not good, not bad, you know what we got?  Nothing.  No credit, no cars, no mortgages -- no wives.  Nothing.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: So tell me, tell me, I'm peeing in my pants.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: -- And now you're going to pee some more.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'm not stepping anywhere --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I appreciate your gentlemanliness, Bill, but what we need to do here is drive the dagger home --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: The dagger --?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Good morning, Drew.  Thanks for coming out.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Well, it's a big day.  Wanted to line up a few ducks before kickoff. Any thoughts?  Last minute refine- ments or variations?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: 'Thoughts'?  Not a one -- but I did hear a voice last night.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: A voice?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: In my sleep.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: What'd it say?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: 'Yes'.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'Yes' to the deal?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Maybe, who knows?  You know how voices are.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I was saying to Quince we won't need --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Did you just hear something?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Why yes, Bill, I was saying to Quince --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No no, not you.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: ...Tomorrow we sign off -- photo opportunity, you and Big John, it'll lead network news.  Okay so far?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Sounds good.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: It's going to be great --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Do you think I need a haircut?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Bill, after this deal, you'll be able to afford one.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Our first annual report, must be thirty-five years ago now, I owned two stations, I wrote down a state- ment of purpose, that one day you would wake up to a Parrish radio station, read a Parrish paper at breakfast, catch our news on tele- vision during the day, and go to bed with one of our books or magazines and you would always be told the truth and in the bargain, have a good time.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: That's great!  Wait 'til I show it to Bontecou.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'm all excited --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I thought it was great, I thought you and Big John would be like a couple of bulls in a china shop --  Instead it was --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Like a marriage made in heaven?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You have a way with words.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: So... Board convenes tomorrow, you'll recommend, we close and it's a deal, right?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: As close as a deal could be.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Olympic.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah, something he goes by --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Oh, excuse me.  This is -- uh -- this is --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Sorry...um - you - you know it's gone right out of my head --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Is there any more to it?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Like 'Smith' or 'Jones --'

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Have we met?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Uh -- he's from out of town --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I get the feeling you've done some business before.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: ...Sounds like you're not leaving much room for discussion.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Sorry.  I know it looks like I'm reversing my field.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: That's your privilege, Bill.  But given our needs, given the absolute necessity for growth, given the fu- ture, the truth is... joining John Bontecou is every bit as certain as - Death and Taxes.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You're not familiar with the phrase, "In this world, nothing is certain but Death and Taxes"?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I am now.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Glad I could be of some help.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Shall we adjourn?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: But the matter's still on the table, Bill --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'Just kidding'?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Sit down, Drew.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Before I do --  I was hoping we might be alone, Bill.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Joe and I have no secrets from each other.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: How nice for you both.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I was hired, you told me, to help bring Parrish Communications into the 21st Century.  This merger is the vehicle --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Joe, cut it out.  And you too, Drew.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I thought this was practically a done deal --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Well now it's undone, okay?  Forget Bontecou!  Scrub him!  I'm tired of his fancy name and his fancy offer. I'm not going for it.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I was a little abrupt with you this afternoon, Drew.  Forgive me.  I want you to know I value your advice.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: As much as Joe's?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You're competitive soul, Drew. That's what makes you a great addi- tion to the money.  Joe is just... around.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: For how long?  And why?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Please.  Don't worry about him.  And above all, don't antagonize him.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Mind if I throw up?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Please, Drew.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I have to go, Bill -- it's been a helluva day.  Need a few minutes to sort everything out.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Okay, we'll see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What is there to say?  They know what John Bontecou is -- and if they didn't, they know now.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yes, you made your feeling abun- dantly clear.  Now they want to do the same with theirs.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What are their feelings?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: If I read this Board right now, they want you to accept Bontecou's offer.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Over my dead body.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: What do you think the Board is going to say when I tell them that?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: With all due respect, you damn well better care because if you try to stonewall them again, there'll be blood on the floor.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Whose?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yours.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I'm feeling real uncomfortable right now because the guy who reports to me is threatening me.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I'm just giving you the truth.  There was a time when William Parrish liked the truth.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I think it's time you went home, Drew.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Certainly.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Did you want to have a cup of coffee or something, Bill?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I don't think so.  Do you?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Bontecou wants a quick response and --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: The answer is no, quick enough for you?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Don't you want to hear the details?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I'm not interested in the details. And I'm not interested in the big picture either.  What I am inter- ersted in is how my Board got conven- ed behind my back, is entertaining a further proposal from a man whom it offends me to do business with, moreover has the audacity to present this to me like a prize fish, and I am expected to clap for it like a performing seal.  No, thank you.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: So I am to understand from your re- sponse that you do not want to hear the details of Bontecou's offer?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Yes, you are to understand that, and now may I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Certainly, Bill.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Are you running this Board or am I?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I've already introduced Mr. Black to you all.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: But who is he?  What are his creden- tials?  What is his relationship to you?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: In English, please.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Mandatory retirement upon our Chairman's sixty-fifth birthday.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I don't know where you get that idea -- the Board agreed --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: The Board didn't know you're a mole who burrowed inside so you could bury us all.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Is this Mr. Black's fantasy?  Another one of his whoppers?  Aren't you sick of this asshole lurking around? No one knows who he is, but one thing everyone does know, he somehow got your ear and has been pouring poison into it ever since.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: I think I'd like to talk to my lawyer --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No lawyers, Drew.  We're going to offer you a deal.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: And what do I get?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: You get not to go to jail.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You're talking through your hat. You're offering a deal because you've got no proof.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Proof?  We've got plenty of proof.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Hey, this is it, the hour approach- es, I'm getting all excited.  So what do you think, is it --  -- just the 'Executive Committee' or could you guys use me?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Quince, m'man, thanks for the offer, but it's all set for just me and Bill. More people might --

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I know.  Gum up the works.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You're overthinking it --

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I don't think they're ordinary.  I love keychains.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Well, I guess he's found one.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Joe, you do get around.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: ...I know you're down, but you know when you're down, Drew, there's no place to go but up.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Thanks, Quince.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Never mind Bontecou.  I've got some other merger possibilities up my sleeve, and I'm putting them to see old man.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: We'll do it together.  I'll clue you in.  Timing's got to be right.  The old man says it's up to Joe.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'It's up to Joe'?  Those were his words?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'It's up to Joe', huh?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Yeah, that's what he said.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Well, that's very interesting.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I thought so, too.  Joe's a neat guy.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah.  Neat.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I'd like to come, too.  See Susan strut her stuff.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: You're on, Quin-cee.  Destination Hospital.  Joe, you'll be the Tour Guide.  Okay?  How's that sound to you?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Well, I'm happy to tell you I've got good news.  As I was telling Drew, I've been making a little hay while the Bontecou sun was shining -- two, possibly three new and boiling hot prospects for merger.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: How did Bill react to the leads you've developed?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: He was interested.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: -- But he was concerned about the timing?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: The timing -- yes.  He says it's up to Joe.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: 'It's up to Joe'?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: That's what he said.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: What have you done?  You've gotten the old man fired!

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: That we did.  Thanks to you.  He was wobbling, mind you, but you spplied the coup de grace.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I'm going to put a stop to this!

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Quince, you can't unscramble scrambled eggs.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: But I didn't mean to do it!

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: The train's left the station, pal, and you're aboard.  Would you like to hear the silver lining?  Check that, gold.  I've been working with John Bontecou all along.  We had a game plan -- acquire Parrish Communications then break it apart and peddle it piece-by-piece to the highest bidder.  I set it up for him, he smacks it out of the park.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I don't want to get rich this way -- I'm going to expose you.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Go right ahead.  Tell William Parrish how you betrayed him at a secret Board meeting.  And tell Allison how you got her father fired -- and he lost his company.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: This is damn big of Bill, I also think it's smart.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: He had no choice.  You're a formidable adversary.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: He said that?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Well, you've got him by the short- hairs.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah, the short, gray hairs.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Obeah.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Obeah evil.  I not evil.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: What you then?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I from dat nex' place.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: You wait here'n to take us?  Like you bus driver to dere?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, no.  I on holiday.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Some spot you pick.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I nuttin' to do wi' dat.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Make it go 'way.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Doctor lady make it irey.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Not dis pain.  Dis pain tru an' tru. Make it go 'way.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Can't, sistah.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Can, mistah.  Take me to dat nex' place.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not time yet.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Make it time.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don' be facety, woman.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: None facety, mistah.  You come for me?  Dat's good news.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, I come to see Doctor.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Doctor?  What could be wrong wit' you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Nuthin'.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Oh, you come to see Doctor Lady?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: My Doctor Lady?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Mine, too.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yah.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: You loved back?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: She knows you real self?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: She knows how she feel.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Rass!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don' need you okayin'.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Schoolboy tings is you head. Badness for you, badness for her, badness for me, lyin' here tumor, big as breadfruit, poison my inners an' waiting.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Brung you flowers and all I gettin's facety back.

turns.speaker: EASTER
turns.text: Only flowers I wan' see's one's over my peaceful self restin' in the dutty.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Can do no right by people.  Come to take, you wan' to stay, leave you stay, you wan' to go.  Rahtid!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Parrish.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Hi, Jennifer.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I've been buzzing you, Mr. Parrish. Are you all right?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Lunch is 'in' today, have you given it any thought --_

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: No.  Nothing.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Nothing?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: -- And call my family, I'd like them to come over for dinner tonight.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Didn't the family get together last night --?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Jennifer.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Of course, Mr. Parrish.  Right away.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Parrish.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Good morning, Jennifer.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: The Board is waiting.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Didn't you call a Board meeting?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: 'Joe Black'.  Won fifteen and lost two for the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1952.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: You bet.  I'm king of my Rotisserie League.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: How long you here, Joe?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: As long as it takes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Black.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Hey, this is fun.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: Don't bother asking, we already tried.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's so very nice to see you again.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's very gracious of you, Quince.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: No problem.  I'll leave you two alone.  I can tell you guys have something on the fire --

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Cirrhosis of the liver is the fifth leading killer of adult Western males.

turns.speaker: QUINCE
turns.text: I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: On the other hand, Winston Churchill drank a bottle of cognac a day and lived until he was ninety-one.
